channel.title: 0.8.29 Patch Notes
channel.description:
## General: * Armor and weapon customization has been added. Prices are lower for now to test. Your inventory will be wiped at some point during the beta. * Added an option in the settings to turn the camera rotation off. * New class added to Casual Mode called The Scorned. * Some optimizations for lower-end PC's.
## Butler: * If a player has Black Wine on them, there will be a character minimum of 3 for their messages. * Added a day ability called Nightshade Wine. After 3 days you can poison the King, causing him to die in two nights if not healed by a Physician. * You will take your own life if you kill a Blue Dragon King.
## King: * The King will no be able to be accused of treason until day 4.
## Noble: * No longer dies when their twin dies. * A Blue Dragon Noble can now win with the Unseen/Cult if their twin was converted.
## Scorned: * The Scorned will be given three targets at the beginning of the game, they must live long enough to see their targets die by any means. * The Scorned is a unique class with night & occupy immune and has two night abilities.
* Bait & Switch - 2 uses: Swap a player with one of your targets, causing anyone targeting that player to now target your target. * Frame - 2 uses: Make a target appear suspicious to investigative roles.
* The Scorned will not start with the King or Prince as targets.

item.title: 0.8.29 Patch Notes
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
I love this different spin on Executioner. It’s much more interactive than its ToS counterpart. Requiring 3 targets to perish is a lot harder, but at least it counts if they die at night. Swapping your target into a Prince claim that will likely die that night sounds fun. I assume Scorned is just a wildcard like the Fool is.

I don’t know what the point of Black Wine is for BD Butlers. Even if you hit a scum with it you are giving them an excuse not to divulge any important information that day and stay quiet.

Read full topic

item.description:
First here and I have to say, I could imagine that these are going to be great changes.
I like the idea of customisation and considering how early on this is, it’s pretty impressive.

The King also now stands a better chance. So when I get it, which I normally do when playing, I think I can say a collective thank you for those who roll it.

Also, as patch note changes get implemented onto Forum games too. I think that while this will improve the game experience itself, improving many roles, it will improve games here too. Nice choices for what was worked on. I like it.
